items.label: thm-bounded-density-ratio
items.title: Bounded Density Ratio for the Euclidean Gas (Justified)
items.content:
1883: :label: thm-bounded-density-ratio
1884: 
1885: **Status**: This is presented as a **justified assumption** rather than a theorem. The arguments below identify all key mechanisms and provide strong heuristic support, but a complete rigorous proof remains future work.
1886: 
1887: **References**: [03_cloning.md](03_cloning), [04_kinetics.md](04_kinetics), [06_convergence.md](06_convergence)
1888: 
1889: Consider the Euclidean Gas dynamics with parameters:
1890: - State space: $\mathcal{X} = B_R(0) \subset \mathbb{R}^d$ (ball of radius $R$)
1891: - Cloning position jitter: $\sigma_x > 0$ ([03_cloning.md](03_cloning), line 6022)
1892: - Langevin noise: $\sigma^2 > 0$ ([04_kinetics.md](04_kinetics))
1893: - Potential: $U : \mathcal{X} \to \mathbb{R}$ with regularity conditions
1894: - Friction: $\gamma > 0$
1895: - Initial density: $\rho_0 = d\mu_0/dx$ with $\|\rho_0\|_\infty \leq M_0 < \infty$
1896: 
1897: Then there exists a finite constant $M = M(\gamma, \sigma_x, \sigma, U, R, M_0, T) < \infty$ such that for all $t \in [0, T]$:
1898: 
1899: $$
1900: \sup_{t \in [0,T]} \sup_{x \in \mathcal{X}_{\text{valid}}} \frac{d\tilde{\mu}_t}{d\tilde{\pi}_{\text{QSD}}}(x) \leq M
1901: 
1902: $$
1903: 
1904: where $\tilde{\mu}_t = \mu_t / \|\mu_t\|$ is the normalized empirical measure and $\tilde{\pi}_{\text{QSD}}$ is the normalized quasi-stationary distribution.
1905: 
1906: Furthermore:
1907: 
1908: $$
1909: M = \frac{C_{\text{hypo}}(M_0, T, \gamma, \sigma, U, R)}{c_{\sigma_x, R} \cdot c_{\text{mass}}}
1910: 
1911: $$
1912: 
1913: where:
1914: - $C_{\text{hypo}}$ is the hypoelliptic smoothing constant

1880: ### 5.1. Statement of the Result
1881: 
1882: :::{prf:assumption} Bounded Density Ratio for the Euclidean Gas (Justified)
1883: :label: thm-bounded-density-ratio
1884: 
1885: **Status**: This is presented as a **justified assumption** rather than a theorem. The arguments below identify all key mechanisms and provide strong heuristic support, but a complete rigorous proof remains future work.
1886: 
1887: **References**: [03_cloning.md](03_cloning), [04_kinetics.md](04_kinetics), [06_convergence.md](06_convergence)
1888: 
1889: Consider the Euclidean Gas dynamics with parameters:
1890: - State space: $\mathcal{X} = B_R(0) \subset \mathbb{R}^d$ (ball of radius $R$)
1891: - Cloning position jitter: $\sigma_x > 0$ ([03_cloning.md](03_cloning), line 6022)
1892: - Langevin noise: $\sigma^2 > 0$ ([04_kinetics.md](04_kinetics))
1893: - Potential: $U : \mathcal{X} \to \mathbb{R}$ with regularity conditions
1894: - Friction: $\gamma > 0$
1895: - Initial density: $\rho_0 = d\mu_0/dx$ with $\|\rho_0\|_\infty \leq M_0 < \infty$
1896: 
1897: Then there exists a finite constant $M = M(\gamma, \sigma_x, \sigma, U, R, M_0, T) < \infty$ such that for all $t \in [0, T]$:
1898: 
1899: $$
1900: \sup_{t \in [0,T]} \sup_{x \in \mathcal{X}_{\text{valid}}} \frac{d\tilde{\mu}_t}{d\tilde{\pi}_{\text{QSD}}}(x) \leq M
1901: 
1902: $$
1903: 
1904: where $\tilde{\mu}_t = \mu_t / \|\mu_t\|$ is the normalized empirical measure and $\tilde{\pi}_{\text{QSD}}$ is the normalized quasi-stationary distribution.
1905: 
1906: Furthermore:
1907: 
1908: $$
1909: M = \frac{C_{\text{hypo}}(M_0, T, \gamma, \sigma, U, R)}{c_{\sigma_x, R} \cdot c_{\text{mass}}}
1910: 
1911: $$
1912: 
1913: where:
1914: - $C_{\text{hypo}}$ is the hypoelliptic smoothing constant
1915: - $c_{\sigma_x, R} = (2\pi \sigma_x^2)^{-d/2} \exp(-(2R)^2/(2\sigma_x^2))$ is the Gaussian mollification lower bound

items.label: thm-bounded-density-summary
items.title: Bounded Density Ratio (Justified Assumption - Summary)
items.content:
2414: :label: thm-bounded-density-summary
2415: 
2416: **Status**: The following is a **well-justified assumption** supported by strong heuristic arguments. A complete rigorous proof remains future work.
2417: 
2418: For the Euclidean Gas with:
2419: - **Cloning position jitter** $\sigma_x > 0$ ([03_cloning.md](03_cloning), Section 4.2.2)
2420: - **Langevin noise** $\sigma^2 > 0$ ([04_kinetics.md](04_kinetics))
2421: - **Bounded initial density** $M_0 < \infty$
2422: 
2423: we assume there exists a finite constant $M_\infty < \infty$ such that:
2424: 
2425: $$
2426: \sup_{t \geq 0} \sup_{x \in \mathcal{X}_{\text{valid}}} \frac{d\tilde{\mu}_t}{d\tilde{\pi}_{\text{QSD}}}(x) \leq M_\infty
2427: 
2428: $$
2429: 
2430: where $\tilde{\mu}_t$ is the normalized empirical measure and $\tilde{\pi}_{\text{QSD}}$ is the normalized quasi-stationary distribution.
2431: 
2432: **Justification Structure**: This assumption is supported through a four-step analysis identifying all key mechanisms:
2433: 
2434: **Step 1: Hypoelliptic L^∞ Bound** (Section 5.3, Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-hypoelliptic-density-bound`)
2435: - Heuristic argument for $\|\rho_t\|_\infty \leq C_{\text{hypo}}(M_0, T, \gamma, \sigma, U, R)$ using Hörmander's theorem
2436: - Sketch controls each operator component (kinetic, cloning, killing, revival)
2437: - References: [06_convergence.md](06_convergence), Section 4.4.1; [09_kl_convergence.md](09_kl_convergence), Section 2
2438: - **Gap**: Complete proof would require parabolic regularity theory adapted to non-local McKean-Vlasov structure
2439: 
2440: **Step 2: Gaussian Mollification** (Section 5.4, Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-gaussian-lower-bound`)
2441: - Argument that Gaussian convolution provides uniform lower bound: $\rho_{\text{post-clone}}(x) \geq c_{\sigma_x, R} \|\rho_{\text{pre}}\|_{L^1}$
2442: - Reference: [03_cloning.md](03_cloning), Section 4.2.2 (position jitter mechanism)
2443: 
2444: **Step 3: QSD Uniform Lower Bound** (Section 5.4.1, Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-qsd-lower-bound`)
2445: - Argument that $\pi_{\text{QSD}}(x) \geq c_\pi > 0$ via:
2446:   - φ-Irreducibility ([06_convergence.md](06_convergence), Section 6.4.1)
2447:   - Full support of invariant measure (Meyn & Tweedie 2009)
2448:   - Smooth density + compact domain → positive infimum
2449: - **Gap**: Relies on positive mass lower bound $c_{\text{mass}} > 0$ which is not rigorously established (see Issue #3)
2450: 
2451: **Step 4: Density Ratio Assembly** (Section 5.5)
2452: - Explicit normalization algebra showing $m_{\text{eq}}$ cancellation
2453: - Finite time bound estimate: $M = C_{\text{hypo}} / (c_{\sigma_x, R} \cdot c_{\text{mass}})$
2454: - Infinite time extension (Section 5.5.1): $M_\infty = \max(M_1, 3/2)$ via QSD convergence
